It includes both clear and cloudy sky radiances and brightness temperatures. North American Drought Monitor - NOAA</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Temperature"/><category term="Precipitation"/><category term="Vegetation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:NADM</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:NADM" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:NADM" rel="alternate" title="North American Drought Monitor - NOAA" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>NOAA National Climatic Data Center (NCDC)</name><email>ncdc.info@noaa.gov</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:32Z</updated><summary>The North American Drought Monitor is an operational map and narrative produced monthly through a collaborative effort of scientists in the United States, Canada, and Mexico.  It is an integrated assessment of drought conditions across the North American continent based on national drought analyses conducted within each of the three participating countries. Continental drought indicators computed from in situ observations, modeled data, and satellite data are used to assess conditions in cross-border areas.  The drought assessment is depicted on the NADM map as drought categories:  D0 (abnormally dry), D1 (moderate drought), D2 (severe drought), D3 (extreme drought), and D4 (exceptional drought).  The drought categories correspond to percentile categories of dryness:  D0 (21-30 percentile), D1 (11-20 percentile), D2 (6-10 percentile), D3 (3-5 percentile), D4 (0-2 percentile).  Drought impact categories (A for agriculture and H for hydrological) are also depicted. The NADM map product shows drought category contours and is manually created in an ArcGIS environment.  The following data are used in the analysis process: In Situ Networks: U.S.: Cooperative Station Network, Climate Division Data Base; Canada: DLY02 and DLY04 Station Network; Mexico: Station Network. Satellites: NOAA-7, 9, 11, 14, 16 and 18 afternoon polar-orbiting satellites. Satellite Instruments:  Vegetation Health Indices (VHI) derived from the radiance observed by the Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (AVHRR). In situ data are point measurements, satellite data (VHI) have 4 km spatial resolution, and modeled soil moisture data are produced on a 0.5 by 0.5 degree grid.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>15.0 -170.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 -50.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/NCDC.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>Please identify NOAA, USDA, AAFC, EC, NDMC, SMN, CONAGUA as the source; otherwise, no use constraints.</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.geonetcastamericas.noaa.gov/" rel="enclosure" title="GEONETCast Americas" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - IASI Carbon Monoxide Profiles FORLI-CO - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Trace_Gases"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2COX</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2COX" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2COX" rel="alternate" title="IASI Carbon Monoxide Profiles FORLI-CO - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:31Z</updated><summary>The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally it is used for the determination of trace gases, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. The carbon monoxide (COx) product is generated with the O3M-SAF ULB/LATMOS FORLI-CO algorithm. It contains the total column and the vertical profiles of CO retrieved from IASI sounder measurements on 19 altitude layers, together with their averaging kernels. The products are provided at the single IASI footprint resolution (which is about 12 km with a spatial sampling of about 25 km at Nadir). This product is available via the Data Centre as the IASI Combined Sounding Products: EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASSND02. Product validation status is pre-Operational.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=IASSND02" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Aqua - Africa" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>NEODAAS, Remote Sensing Group, Plymouth Marine Laboratory</name><email>sbernard@csir.co.za</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:32Z</updated><summary>Mapped ocean data products from NASA's MODIS (Aqua) sensor, including chlorophyll-a, sea surface temperature, K490 (turbidity) and water leaving radiances. Regional data available for Algeria, Egypt, Ghana, Libya, Mozambique, Morocco (North), Red Sea, Sierra Leone, or Morocco (South). Can be used free of charge, but may not be (re-)sold. Please acknowledge PML in publications and notify rsg@pml.ac.uk</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-28.0 -24.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>40.0 75.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Meteosat Surface Albedo - MFG - Indian Ocean 63 E</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Climate"/><category term="Thematic_Climate_Data_Record"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:CM:MFG:MET5-MSA1-IODC</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:CM:MFG:MET5-MSA1-IODC" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:CM:MFG:MET5-MSA1-IODC" rel="alternate" title="Meteosat Surface Albedo - MFG - Indian Ocean 63 E" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:32Z</updated><summary>Ten-day composite surface albedo in the Meteosat VIS band at pixel resolution. The Meteosat Surface Albedo (MSA) product contains an estimation of surface albedos and corresponding uncertainty acquired under direct (black sky albedo) and perfectly diffuse (white sky albedo) illumination derived from observations acquired by the Meteosat First Generation (MFG) radiometer in the VIS band. This product is derived from any archived MFG observations, i.e., starting in 1998 (Meteosat 5) for the longitude 63 degree East mission (IODC) mission. The MSA product is derived in the Meteosat VIS band every 10 days at the VIS pixel resolution, i.e., about 3 km. The HDF4 format is provided as a tar file with albedo (around 150MB) and ancillary (around 570MB) data included. This is a Thematic Climate Data Record (TCDR).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -2.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 128.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/MSA_V2.1_063_DHR30_2001_121_130_final.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPMSA1" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Cloud Type - Multimission</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Cloud"/><category term="Climate"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:CM:MULT:CTY</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:CM:MULT:CTY" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:CM:MULT:CTY" rel="alternate" title="Cloud Type - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>CM SAF</name><email>contact.cmsaf@dwd.de</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:32Z</updated><summary>The CTY product is based on results from the SAF NWC Cloud Type algorithms for both polar and geostationary satellite data. The following five cloud classes are defined: Low clouds; Mid clouds; Opaque high clouds; Thin high clouds and Fractional clouds. Thus, the CTY results are given as five individual components. The resulting average value denotes the percentage of pixels of the appropriate class relative to all cloudy pixels in each 15x15 grid. The SEVIRI baseline (Europe), SEVIRI full Meteosat Disk, AVHRR baseline (Europe) and AVHRR Arctic are operational.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/climatecfc.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://wui.cmsaf.eu" rel="enclosure" title="CM_SAF_Archive_and_FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=CLMCTY" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product (2004 to 2012)" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Outgoing Longwave Radiation - MSG</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Radiation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:OLR</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:OLR" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:OLR" rel="alternate" title="Outgoing Longwave Radiation - MSG" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:33Z</updated><summary>The Earth Radiation budget is made up of the incoming solar flux and the outgoing Top-of-the-Atmosphere (TOA) radiative fluxes. The outgoing radiative fluxes consist of the reflected part of the incoming solar flux, as well as the thermal flux emitted by the Earth-atmosphere system. The thermal flux is often referred to as Outgoing Longwave Radiation (OLR). The OLR is a very important parameter for the Earth's radiation budget study as well as for weather/climate model validation purposes. Variations in the OLR reflect the response of the Earth-atmosphere system to solar diurnal forcing. Those variations can be found in particular in surface temperature, cloud cover, cloud top height, and related quantities like precipitation. The OLR is therefore well suited for validation of global circulation models (GCMs) simulating the diurnal cycle, as it constitutes the combination of different modelaspects. The algorithm required to create this product is available in the Product Factsheet (see Online Resources or Distribution). </summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/outgoing_longwave_radiation.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/wcm/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=PDF_OLR_FACTSHEET&RevisionSelectionMethod=LatestReleased&Rendition=Web" rel="enclosure" title="Algorithm (Product Factsheet)" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Offline Ozone Profile from Joint IASI and GOME-2 - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Trace_Gases"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:OOPGI</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:OOPGI" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:OOPGI" rel="alternate" title="Offline Ozone Profile from Joint IASI and GOME-2 - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>O3M SAF</name><email>o3msaf@fmi.fi</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:33Z</updated><summary>This product is under development. A description will be provided at a later stage in development.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation - PROBA-V - Africa</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Vegetation"/><category term="Radiation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:PROBA-V:FAPAR</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:PROBA-V:FAPAR" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:PROBA-V:FAPAR" rel="alternate" title="Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation - PROBA-V - Africa" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EC Copernicus Global Land Service, operated by VITO</name><email>helpdeskticket@vgt.vito.be</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:33Z</updated><summary>FAPAR corresponds to the fraction of photosynthetically active radiation absorbed by the canopy. The FAPAR value results directly from the radiative transfer model in the canopy which is computed instantaneously. It depends on canopy structure, vegetation element optical properties and illumination conditions. FAPAR is very useful as input to a number of primary productivity models which run at the daily time step. Consequently, the product definition should correspond to the daily integrated FAPAR value that can be approached by computation of the clear sky daily integrated FAPAR values as well as the FAPAR value computed for diffuse conditions. The GEOV1 FAPAR product corresponds to the instantaneous black-sky around 10:15 which is a close approximation of the daily integrated black-sky FAPAR value. The FAPAR refers only to the green parts of the canopy.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-40 -30</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>40 60</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>Unrestricted</rights><link href="http://land.copernicus.eu/global" rel="enclosure" title="Access the product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Cloud Top Temperature - Multimission</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Cloud"/><category term="Climate"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:CM:MULT:CTT</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:CM:MULT:CTT" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:CM:MULT:CTT" rel="alternate" title="Cloud Top Temperature - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>CM SAF</name><email>contact.cmsaf@dwd.de</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:33Z</updated><summary>The Cloud Top Height information is expressed as Cloud Top Temperature (CTT) in Kelvin. The 3-hourly Low Mid Latitude DLIvalues are mean values over the considered period of time, 3 or 24 hours. Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:34Z</updated><summary>The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=ASCSZR1B" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/WMOInformationSystem/GTSRMDCN/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="GTS Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/wcm/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=pdf_gts_bulletin_hdrs_metop&RevisionSelectionMethod=LatestReleased&Rendition=Web" rel="enclosure" title="Abbreviated Bulletin Headers for Metop-A & Metop-B" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/wcm/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=ZIP_METOP_ASCSZR1B_SAMPLE_FILES&RevisionSelectionMethod=LatestReleased&Rendition=Web" rel="enclosure" title="Sample product files" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Optimal Cloud Analysis - MSG - 0 degree</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Cloud"/><category term="Pressure"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:OCA</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:OCA" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:OCA" rel="alternate" title="Optimal Cloud Analysis - MSG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:34Z</updated><summary>The Optimal Cloud Analysis is an algorithm to extract the principal cloud parameters (phase, pressure, optical thickness and effective radius) using an optimal estimation method and simultaneously all the SEVIRI spectral measurements. This combination allows for robust quality control (checking the scene corresponds to the cloud model) and systematic parameter error analysis. As part of the quality control, multi-layer clouds are identified and reprocessed with an adjusted model setup that permits the retrieval of two layer quantities. In the current configuration, the IR 3.9 \ufffd\ufffdm and IR 9.6 \ufffd\ufffdm measurements are made passive because of difficulties in the radiative transfer modelling.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -65.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/optimal_cloud_analysis.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MSGOCAE" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Sea Surface Temperature - MFG - Indian Ocean - Reprocessed</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Ocean"/><category term="Sea_Surface_Temperature"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:SST1-IODC</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:SST1-IODC" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:SST1-IODC" rel="alternate" title="Sea Surface Temperature - MFG - Indian Ocean - Reprocessed" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:34Z</updated><summary>The Sea Surface Temperature (SST) product is generated for every segment where the sea surface is visible, using the low resolution 80 x 80 segment matrix. Each product is generated twice daily and contains an accumulation of data from the preceding 12 hour period. Land segments, and those segments with continuous cloud cover during the period of observation are excluded. A typical product contains around 1200 segment values.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -2.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 128.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPSSTP1" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Global Sea Ice Type - Multimission</title><category term="oceans"/><category term="Sea_Ice"/><category term="Ocean"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:GBLSIT</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:GBLSIT" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:GBLSIT" rel="alternate" title="Global Sea Ice Type - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Ocean and Sea Ice</name><email>si-saf.manager@meteo.fr</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:34Z</updated><summary>The sea ice products have been developed to be derived from passive microwave, active microwave and optical sensors, using multi sensor methods with a Bayesian approach to combine different instruments and sensors. At present only SSM/I data from three channels is used operationally.They consist of Sea Ice Edge (closed ice/open ice/open water), Sea Ice Concentration (%) and Sea Ice Type (multi-year/first-year).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/osi_gbl_sit.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.osi-saf.org" rel="enclosure" title="OSI SAF Archive and FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=OSITYGB" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - MFG - ADC" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:35Z</updated><summary>Atlantic Data Coverage (ADC) image data in the form of high-rate transmissions in 3 spectral channels available at 30-minute intervals. Level 1.5 images are pre-processed in such a way that all image pixels are remapped on to a reference image corresponding to an image taken by the satellite located at its nominal position over the equator and with a nominal attitude, i.e. with the satellite spin axis parallel to the spin axis of the earth. In addition, all image lines are aligned and the coordinates of image pixels of the different radiometer channels are adjusted so that they correspond to information from the same point on the earth's surface.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -131.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 31.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/VIS6_METEOSAT3-MVIRI-MTP15-NA-NA-19910811163000.png" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTP15" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Land Surface Temperature - NOAA - South America</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Land_Surface_Temperature"/><category term="Land"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:LST</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:LST" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:LST" rel="alternate" title="Land Surface Temperature - NOAA - South America" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>National Institute for Space Research</name><email>atusdsa@cptec.inpe.br</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:35Z</updated><summary>This product is generated based on data from polar orbiting satellite NOAA-18, which uses 2 channels in the thermal infrared region of around 10.5 and 11.5 micrometers, channels 4 and 5 of the instrument Advanced Very High Radiometer Reolution (AVHRR). The LST is estimated only for clear-sky pixels of which are identified based on algorithms for masking of clouds. Frequency 4 is per day.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-38.0 -85.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>15.0 -32.5</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/LST.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.geonetcastamericas.noaa.gov/" rel="enclosure" title="GEONETCast Americas" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Data Collection and Retransmission</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Observation"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:OBS:DCP</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:OBS:DCP" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:OBS:DCP" rel="alternate" title="Data Collection and Retransmission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:35Z</updated><summary>One of the functions of the system of geostationary meteorological satellites is the collection of environmental data from Data Collection Platforms (DCP).  DCPs are automatic, or semi-automatic, in-situ environmental observing systems, which may be integrated into an automatic weather station, an automatic river or tide gauge, or placed on an aircraft, ship, balloon or buoy. The Meteosat Data Collection System (DCS) enables DCP Operators within the footprint of the satellite to use the Meteosat system to retransmit those DCP data via the Meteosat satellites for onward delivery to users via EUMETCast, FTP download stations and to the Global Telecommunication System (GTS) community. The Meteosat system supports both standard (100bps) and high-rate (1200bps) DCPs from both MFG and MSG, allowing for improved capabilities and warnings of potentially devastating natural phenomena such as tsunamis. The DCS is particularly useful for the collection of data from remote locations where it may provide the only possibility for data relay.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/WMOInformationSystem/GTSRMDCN/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="GTS Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#meteosatdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Meteosat Direct Dissemination Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://oiswww.eumetsat.org/SDDI/webapps/publicdcp/introduction.jsp" rel="enclosure" title="Login to the Public DCP Service" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The Global Ozone Monitoring Experiment-2 (GOME-2) spectrometer measures profiles and total columns of ozone and of other atmospheric constituents that are related to the depletion of ozone in the stratosphere and its production in the troposphere, as well as to natural and anthropogenic sources of pollution.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/gome2_ozone_071003.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#metopdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Metop Direct Readout Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - ASCAT GDS Level 1 Sigma0 at Full Sensor Resolution - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><category term="Ocean"/><category term="Land"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><category term="Radar_Backscatter_NRCS"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B" rel="alternate" title="ASCAT GDS Level 1 Sigma0 at Full Sensor Resolution - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:37Z</updated><summary>The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=ASCSZF1B" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/wcm/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=ZIP_METOP_ASCSZF1B_SAMPLE_FILES&RevisionSelectionMethod=LatestReleased&Rendition=Web" rel="enclosure" title="Sample product files" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:37Z</updated><summary>The AHRPT Direct Broadcast service provides local user stations with real-time transmission of data, limited to the instantaneous sub-satellite observation. Data received through Direct Readout can be processed further using the local processing software is available under licence from the NWP-SAF (AAPP and RTTOVS). The GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) Receiver for Atmospheric Sounding (GRAS) probes the vertical profile of the atmosphere by observing GPS (Global Positioning Satellite) in a limb sounding geometry. GRAS observes so-called rising and setting occultations in velocity and anti-velocity direction, providing a minimum of 500 profiles per day with high vertical resolution. The raw data can be processed further to profiles of bending angle over impact parameter at level 1B and to refractivity, temperature, and humidity over altitude at level 2, covering the stratosphere and troposphere. In addition, the ionospheric total electron content can be deduced from the measurement.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#metopdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Metop Direct Readout Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Offline Absorbing Aerosol Index - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Aerosol"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ARSAAI</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ARSAAI" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ARSAAI" rel="alternate" title="Offline Absorbing Aerosol Index - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>O3M SAF</name><email>o3msaf@fmi.fi</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:37Z</updated><summary>The Absorbing Aerosol Indicator (ARS/AAI) indicates the presence of elevated absorbing aerosols in the Earth's atmosphere. Since it distinguishes between scattering and absorbing effects, it does not suffer much from cloud contamination. The aerosol types that are mostly seen are desert dust and biomass burning aerosols.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/o3m_aai.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=O3MARS" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://o3msaf.fmi.fi/" rel="enclosure" title="SAF Archive & FTP" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - MFG - Indian Ocean 57 E" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:38Z</updated><summary>Ten-day composite surface albedo in the Meteosat VIS band at pixel resolution. The Meteosat Surface Albedo (MSA) product contains an estimation of surface albedos and corresponding uncertainty acquired under direct (black sky albedo) and perfectly diffuse (white sky albedo) illumination derived from observations acquired by the Meteosat First Generation (MFG) radiometer in the VIS band. This product is derived from any archived MFG observations, i.e., starting in 2006 (Meteosat 7) for the longitude 57 degree East mission (IODC) mission. The MSA product is derived in the Meteosat VIS band every 10 days at the VIS pixel resolution, i.e., about 3 km. The HDF4 format is provided as a tar file with albedo (around 150MB) and ancillary (around 570MB) data included. This is a Thematic Climate Data Record (TCDR).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -8.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 122.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/MSA_V2.1_063_DHR30_2001_121_130_final.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPMSA1" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included. The Low Rate data are sub-sets of data or data sets compressed by higher factors.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="https://eoportal.eumetsat.int" rel="enclosure" title="Login to download" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Meteosat Direct Dissemination Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Soil Moisture Profile Index in the roots region retrieved by surface wetness scatterometer assimilation method</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Precipitation"/><category term="Model"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MODEL:SM-DAS-2</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MODEL:SM-DAS-2" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MODEL:SM-DAS-2" rel="alternate" title="Soil Moisture Profile Index in the roots region retrieved by surface wetness scatterometer assimilation method" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Support to Operational Hydrology and Water Management </name><email>us_hsaf@meteoam.it</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:38Z</updated><summary>Analysed liquid soil moisture profile index for four different soil layers (covering the root zone from the surface to ~ 3 metres) generated by the ECMWF soil moisture assimilation system at 24 hour time steps. The analysed soil moisture fields are based on a modelled first guess, the screen-level temperature and humidity analyses, and the ASCAT-derived surface soil moisture. They are then re-scaled soil wetness index by normalising by the saturated soil moisture value as a function of soil type. The Global product is generated starting from the Global surface soil moisture product (CAF product, SM-OBS-3 when becomes available)</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/sm-das-2.png" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://hsaf.meteoam.it/" rel="enclosure" title="SAF Archive & FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Algorithm is a physical parameterization applied separately to every pixel of a satellite image to derive an instantaneous field of the Solar Surface Irradiance. An essential point is the calculation of products interpolated at rounded UT hours. A radiative flux calculated on a satellite image is not homogeneous in time (the pixel time varies from north to south, of about 24 minutes for GOES-E data).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-60.0 -135.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>60.0 -15.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=OSIHSSI" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The composite scene (sector) images will have approximately the boundaries of the HRC imagery (27km swath), 10 meter average resolution and are radiometrically and geometrically corrected. The measurements are obtained through the processing of scatterometer data originating from the ASCAT instrument on EUMETSAT's Metop satellite, as described in the ASCAT Wind Product User Manual. Note that up until 2011-02-28, a wind-only version of this product in BUFR and netCDF formats was available via EUMETCast and the EUMETSAT Data Centre. From that date on, the wind values can be found in BUFR format in the ASCAT multi-parameter products (collection reference: EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:OAS012 and EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:OAS025)</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/osi_ascat25.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=OASW025" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product (until 28/02/2011) " type="text/html"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/Extended.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:OAS025" rel="enclosure" title="Please order from ASCAT Winds and Soil Moisture for data from 28/02/11 onwards" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.osi-saf.org" rel="enclosure" title="OSI SAF Archive and FTP" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - 4 \ufffd\ufffdm wavelength region directly without scattering. It is expressed in W m-2. This is a Thematic Climate Data Record (TCDR).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-70 -70</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>70 70</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/example_image_SID_200306.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://wui.cmsaf.eu" rel="enclosure" title="CM SAF Web User Interface" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=CLMSID " rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The Upper Tropospheric Humidity product uses the Meteosat First Generation low resolution 80 x 80 segment matrix with 32 x 32 pixel segments.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -65.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPTPHU1" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Airmass RGB - MSG - 0 degree</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Cloud"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:AIRMASS</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:AIRMASS" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:AIRMASS" rel="alternate" title="Airmass RGB - MSG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:40Z</updated><summary>The Airmass product is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite based upon data from infrared and water vapour channels from Meteosat Second Generation. It is designed and tuned to monitor the evolution of cyclones, in particular rapid cyclogenesis, jet streaks and PV (potential vorticity) anomalies. Due to the incorporation of the water vapour and ozone channels, its usage at high satellite viewing angles is limited. The Airmass RGB is composed from data from a combination of the SEVIRI WV6.2, WV7.3, IR9.7 and IR10.8 channels.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/FRAME_OIS_RGB-airmass-centralEurope_0911240500.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://oiswww.eumetsat.org/IPPS/html/MSG/RGB/AIRMASS/" rel="enclosure" title="View on our website" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - IASI Ozone - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Trace_Gases"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2OZO</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2OZO" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2OZO" rel="alternate" title="IASI Ozone - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:40Z</updated><summary>The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally it is used for the determination of trace gases, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. The Ozone (OZO) product contains total column ozone, the vertical profile of ozone retrieved from IASI sounder measurements on 101 pressure levels and its full error estimate (error covariance matrix). The products are provided at the single IASI footprint resolution (which is about 12 km with a spatial sampling of about 25 km at Nadir). This product is available via the Data Centre as the IASI Combined Sounding Products: EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASSND02. Product validation status is Operational only for the total column; the partial columns have pre-operational validity.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/iasi_ozone.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/WMOInformationSystem/GTSRMDCN/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="GTS Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/wcm/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=pdf_gts_bulletin_hdrs_metop&RevisionSelectionMethod=LatestReleased&Rendition=Web" rel="enclosure" title="Abbreviated Bulletin Headers" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=IASSND02" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>OSI SAF</name><email>osi-saf.manager@meteo.fr</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:40Z</updated><summary>The sea ice products have been developed to be derived from passive microwave, active microwave and optical sensors, using multi sensor methods with a Bayesian approach to combine different instruments and sensors. At present only SSM/I data from three channels is used operationally. They consist of Sea Ice Edge (closed ice/open ice/open water), Sea Ice Concentration (%) and Sea Ice Type (multi-year/first-year).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/osi_gbl_sie.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=OSIEDGB" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.osi-saf.org" rel="enclosure" title="OSI SAF Archive and FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Fractional Vegetation Cover - MSG</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Vegetation"/><category term="Land"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FVC-SEVIRI</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FVC-SEVIRI" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FVC-SEVIRI" rel="alternate" title="Fractional Vegetation Cover - MSG" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Land Surface Analysis</name><email>helpdesk.landsaf@ipma.pt</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:40Z</updated><summary>Fractional Vegetation Cover (FVC) defines an important structural property of a plant canopy, which corresponds to the complement to unity of the gap fraction at nadir direction, accounting for the amount of vegetation distributed in a horizontal perspective. FVC is related with the partition between soil and vegetation contribution for emissivity and temperature. This property is necessary for describing land surface processes and surface parameterisation schemes used for climate and weather forecasting. Besides, the FVC is relevant for a wide range of Land Biosphere Applications such us agriculture and forestry, environmental management and land use, hydrology, natural hazards monitoring and management, vegetation-soil dynamics monitoring, drought conditions and fire scar extent.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/lsa_fvc.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://landsaf.ipma.pt" rel="enclosure" title="LSA SAF Archive and FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Active Fire Monitoring (ASCII) - MSG - 0 degree</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Fire"/><category term="Land"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FIR-ASCII</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FIR-ASCII" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FIR-ASCII" rel="alternate" title="Active Fire Monitoring (ASCII) - MSG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:21Z</updated><summary>The active fire monitoring product is a fire detection product indicating the presence of fire within a pixel. The underlying concept of the algorithm takes advantage of the fact that SEVIRI channel IR3.9 is very sensitive to hot spots which are caused by fires. The algorithm distinguishes between potential fire and active fire. Applications and Users: Fire detection and monitoring. Note that the ASCII version of this product has been superseded by the Active Fire Monitoring (CAP) version (EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FIRC). ASCII formatted product is only available as a historical archive.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -65.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/msgfir.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MSGFIRA" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Merged Atlantic Product Surface Solar Irradiance - Multimission</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Radiation"/><category term="Ocean"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:MAPSSI</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:MAPSSI" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:MAPSSI" rel="alternate" title="Merged Atlantic Product Surface Solar Irradiance - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>OSI SAF</name><email>osi-saf.manager@meteo.fr</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:20Z</updated><summary>Estimation of the solar irradiance reaching the Earth surface , derived from the geostationary satellites data (GOES and MSG). IASI GDS Level 1 Principal Component Residuals - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASPCR01</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASPCR01" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASPCR01" rel="alternate" title="IASI GDS Level 1 Principal Component Residuals - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:20Z</updated><summary>The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally it is used for the determination of trace gases such as ozone, nitrous oxide, carbon dioxide and methane, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. The IASI Principal component residuals product are the differences between IASI radiance spectra (see the IASI GDS L1C), and the same spectra compressed by the Principal Component Analysis method (see the IASI Principal component scores). By combining the noise-reduced spectra reconstructed from the principal component scores with the principal component residuals, one obtains radiance spectra identical to the original ones to within the quantisation step. </summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/IASI_principal_component_residuals.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=IASPCR1C" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The NRT/UV Index Cloud Corrected product is under development. The VPI is typically used to assess overall vegetation condition and to identify areas with below normal vegetation development, possibly linked to low agricultural productivity, as compared to what can be expected based on the historical range. Furthermore, VPI can also be used to identify drought affected areas</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-56 -93</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>25 -33</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>Unrestricted</rights><link href="http://land.copernicus.eu/global" rel="enclosure" title="Access the product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW -
