The product is calculated as follows: (Current t cumulate Rainfall - LTAvg t cumulate Rainfall)*100 / LTAvg cumulate Rainfall.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-35.0 -11.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>6.0 41</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Meteosat Surface Albedo - MFG - 0 degree</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Climate"/><category term="Thematic_Climate_Data_Record"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:CM:MFG:MSA1</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:CM:MFG:MSA1" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:CM:MFG:MSA1" rel="alternate" title="Meteosat Surface Albedo - MFG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:22Z</updated><summary>Ten-day composite surface albedo in the Meteosat VIS band at pixel resolution. The Meteosat Surface Albedo (MSA) product contains an estimation of surface albedos and corresponding uncertainty acquired under direct (black sky albedo) and perfectly diffuse (white sky albedo) illumination derived from observations acquired by the Meteosat First Generation (MFG) radiometer in the VIS band. This product is derived from any archived MFG observations, i.e., from 1982 (Meteosat 2) up to 2006 (Meteosat 7) for the zero degree longitude mission. The MSA product is derived in the Meteosat VIS band every 10 days at the VIS pixel resolution, i.e., about 3 km. The HDF4 format is provided as a tar file with albedo (around 150MB) and ancillary (around 570MB) data included. This is a Thematic Climate Data Record (TCDR).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -65.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/MSA_V2.1_000_DHR30_2001_121_130_final.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPMSA1" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>CM SAF</name><email>contact.cmsaf@dwd.de</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:23Z</updated><summary>Derived directly from the results of the CM-SAF Cloud Mask (CM) product, the fractional cloud cover (CFC) is defined as the fraction of cloudy pixels per sub-region compared to the total number of analysed pixels in the sub-region. In this case it means that the fractional cloud cover is computed as the fraction of all pixels within a 15x15 km grid square that has been classified as either cloud-filled or cloud contaminated. The SEVIRI baseline (Europe), SEVIRI full Meteosat Disk, AVHRR baseline (Europe) and AVHRR Arctic are operational. Fractional cloud cover is expressed in percent.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/climatecfc.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://wui.cmsaf.eu" rel="enclosure" title="CM_SAF_Archive_and_FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=CLMCFC" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product (2004 to 2012)" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The product may be processed in different ways and have different quality depending on the surface being flat, forested or mountainous. The algorithm is based on assimilating MW brightness temperatures of several channels at frequencies with different penetration in snow, into a first-guess field built by the (sparse) network of stations measuring snow depth for flat areas, for mountainous areas snow depth measured at stations is not used directly in the algorithm.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-25 25</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>75 45</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/sn-obs-4.png" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Map of current Rainfall (from remote sensing) compared with the Long Term Average for assessment and detection of possible anomalies (mm). The product is calculated as follows: (Current Rainfall / LTAvg Rainfall).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-35.0 -11.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>6.0 41</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Fire Radiative Power Grid - MSG</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Fire"/><category term="Land"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FRPGRID-SEVIRI</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FRPGRID-SEVIRI" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:FRPGRID-SEVIRI" rel="alternate" title="Fire Radiative Power Grid - MSG" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Land Surface Analysis</name><email>helpdesk.landsaf@ipma.pt</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:25Z</updated><summary>The FRPGRID product contains an hourly estimation of the FRP at one degree resolution and includes several correction factors. The Fire Radiative Power product (FRP, in MWatts) provides information on the measured radiant heat output of detected fires. It has been demonstrated in small-scale experimental fires that the amount of radiant heat energy liberated per unit time (the Fire Radiative Power) is related to the rate at which fuel is being consumed [1]. This is a direct result of the combustion process, whereby carbon-based fuel is oxidised to CO2 with the release of a certain 'heat yield'. Therefore, measuring this FRP and integrating it over the lifetime of the fire provides an estimate of the total Fire Radiative Energy (FRE), which for wildfires should be proportional to the total mass of fuel biomass combusted.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/LSA_FRP_Grid.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://landsaf.meteo.pt" rel="enclosure" title="LSA_SAF_Archive_and_FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - AMSU-A AHRPT - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:AMSU-AHRPT</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:AMSU-AHRPT" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:AMSU-AHRPT" rel="alternate" title="AMSU-A AHRPT - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:25Z</updated><summary>The AHRPT Direct Broadcast service provides local user stations with real-time transmission of data, limited to the instantaneous sub-satellite observation. Data received through Direct Readout can be processed further using the local processing software is available under licence from the NWP-SAF (AAPP and RTTOVS). The Advanced Microwave Sounding Unit-A (AMSU-A) is a 15-channel microwave radiometer that is used for measuring global atmospheric temperature profiles and will provide information on atmospheric water in all of its phases (with the exception of small ice particles, which are transparent at microwave frequencies). AMSU-A will provide information even in cloudy conditions. AMSU-A measures Earth radiance at frequencies (in GHz) as listed under the instrument channel information.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#metopdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Metop Direct Readout Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Current Condition Cumulate Rainfall Map - Multimission - Southern Africa</title><category term="environment"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Precipitation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:GRFECUM</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:GRFECUM" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:GRFECUM" rel="alternate" title="Current Condition Cumulate Rainfall Map - Multimission - Southern Africa" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>Botswana Department of Meteorological Services</name><email>imkusane@gmail.com</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:25Z</updated><summary>An AMESD / SADC-THEMA product. This is the sum of the rainfall measurements from ground rain gauges from start of season (first dekad of September) to the current period.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-35.0 -11.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>6.0 41</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - HRI Level 1.5 Image Data - MFG - 0 degree</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Ocean"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:HRI</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:HRI" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:HRI" rel="alternate" title="HRI Level 1.5 Image Data - MFG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:24Z</updated><summary>Image data in the form of high rate transmissions in 3 spectral channels available at 30-minute intervals with coverage over Europe, Africa, North Atlantic and parts of South America. Level 1.5 images are pre-processed in such a way that all image pixels are remapped on to a reference image corresponding to an image taken by the MTP satellite located at its nominal position over the equator and with a nominal attitude, i.e. with the satellite spin axis parallel to the spin axis of the earth. In addition, all image lines are aligned and the coordinates of image pixels of the different radiometer channels are adjusted so that they correspond to information from the same point on the earth's surface.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -81.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 81.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/mtp-level-1-5.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTP15" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:24Z</updated><summary>OrbitView is an RGB (Red, Green, Blue) composite based on Metop AVHRR channels 1, 2 and 4. Note that the image is not calibrated. </summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/orbitview_rgb.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://oiswww.eumetsat.org/IPPS/html/METOP/RGB/ORBITVIEW_124/index.htm" rel="enclosure" title="View on our website" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - ASCAT Regional Ocean Surface Winds at 12.5 km Node Grid - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><category term="Radar_Backscatter_NRCS"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="Ocean"/><category term="Ocean_Surface_Wind"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:EARS-ASCAT</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:EARS-ASCAT" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:EARS-ASCAT" rel="alternate" title="ASCAT Regional Ocean Surface Winds at 12.5 km Node Grid - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:25Z</updated><summary>The ASCAT Wind Product contains measurements of the wind direction and wind speed at 10 m above the sea surface. The measurements are obtained through the processing of scatterometer data originating from the ASCAT instrument on EUMETSAT's Metop satellite, as described in the ASCAT Wind Product User Manual. In the context of this regional service, the data is acquired both from the last 30 minutes of the ASCAT Metop main Svalbard dump, as well as from the EUMETSAT Advanced Retransmission Service (EARS) network of Direct Readout stations in Europe and the middle East. All data are processed jointly by the EARS ground system and the Koningklijk Nederlands Meteorologisch Instituut (KNMI) within 45 minutes. This product in intended for Nowcasting applications, where high timeliness and resolution are very important. </summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>0.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/ascat12_5_combined.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/WMOInformationSystem/GTSRMDCN/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="GTS Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>CM SAF</name><email>contact.cmsaf@dwd.de</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:25Z</updated><summary>This product provides information on the Cloud Liquid Water Path (CWP) given in kg/m2. The CWP is calculated as a function of the Cloud Optical Thickness and the estimated droplet effective radius. Note that for the current version of the product the CWP product does not include contributions from ice water or water vapour.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/climatecwp.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://wui.cmsaf.eu" rel="enclosure" title="CM_SAF_Archive_and_FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=CLMCWP" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product (2004 to 2012)" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Clear Sky Radiances - MFG -  Indian Ocean - Reprocessed</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Radiation"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:CSR1-IODC</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:CSR1-IODC" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:CSR1-IODC" rel="alternate" title="Clear Sky Radiances - MFG -  Indian Ocean - Reprocessed" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:27Z</updated><summary>The Clear Sky Radiances (CSR) product contains information on mean brightness temperatures and radiances from all thermal (e.g. infrared and water vapour) channels, for those regions containing no or only low-level clouds. Applications and users: Numerical weather prediction</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -2.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 128.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPCSKR1" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Refined Ocean Products - Aqua - AMESD Regions</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Ocean"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:AQUA:ROPMAD</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:AQUA:ROPMAD" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:AQUA:ROPMAD" rel="alternate" title="Refined Ocean Products - Aqua - AMESD Regions" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>PML</name><email>rsg@pml.ac.uk</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:26Z</updated><summary>These are ocean products for the AMESD regions of the African coastline and are the MODIS 'refined mode' version of the near-real-time (NRT) products already distributed under the AMESD project. The refined mode versions use accurate atmospheric measurements vs. estimates in the NRT and are produced after a week or two delay.  Regional data is available for the Indian Ocean: east and north east of Madagascar, Cape Verde, Mozambique, Nigeria, South Somalia (SSomalia) and Tanzania. Can be used free of charge, but may not be (re-)sold. Please acknowledge PML in publications and notify rsg@pml.ac.uk</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-50 -30</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>40 74</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Vegetation Condition Index - PROBA-V - South America</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Vegetation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:PROBA-V:VCISA</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:PROBA-V:VCISA" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:PROBA-V:VCISA" rel="alternate" title="Vegetation Condition Index - PROBA-V - South America" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EC Copernicus Global Land Service, operated by VITO</name><email>helpdeskticket@vgt.vito.be</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:26Z</updated><summary>The Vegetation Condition Indicator (VCI) is a categorical type of difference vegetation index. The VCI compares the observed NDVI to the range of values observed in the same period in previous years. The VCI is expressed in % and gives an idea where the observed value is situated between the extreme values (minimum and maximum) in the previous years. Lower and higher values indicate bad and good vegetation state conditions, respectively.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-60 -60</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>30 30</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int/smartEditor/preview/g2_BIOPAR_VCI_QL_201311210000_S-America_VGT_V1.0.png" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>Unrestricted</rights><link href="http://land.copernicus.vgt.vito.be/PDF/portal/Application.html#Browse;Root=513186;Collection=728779;Time=NORMAL,NORMAL,1,JANUARY,2013,31,MAY,2014" rel="enclosure" title="Product access portal" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - ASCAT L1 SZR Climate Data Record Release 2 - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Climate"/><category term="Fundamental_Climate_Data_Record"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:CM:METOP:ASCSZRR02</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:CM:METOP:ASCSZRR02" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:CM:METOP:ASCSZRR02" rel="alternate" title="ASCAT L1 SZR Climate Data Record Release 2 - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:26Z</updated><summary>Reprocessed L1B data from the Advanced Scatterometer (ASCAT) on METOP-A, resampled at 12.5 km Swath Grid (SZR). Normalized radar cross section (NRCS) triplets of the Earth surface together with measurement time, location (latitude and longitude) and geometrical information (incidence and azimuth angles). The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product is also available at full resolution and at 25 km Swath Grid. This is a Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR). </summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=ASCSZR1B0200" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product (not available until early 2015)" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Scatterometer Processing Packages - Multimission</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Sea_Ice"/><category term="Ocean"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:SW:MULT:037</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:SW:MULT:037" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:SW:MULT:037" rel="alternate" title="Scatterometer Processing Packages - Multimission" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>NWP SAF</name><email>nwpsaf@metoffice.gov.uk</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:26Z</updated><summary>Observation operators for SCAT, ASCAT, and SeaWinds. Scatterometer data processors for SeaWinds (SDP) and ASCAT (AWDP) are supplied and maintained by the NWP SAF. These packages process radar backscatter data to wind vector field solutions featuring: *Local representation of the full wind vector PDF based on the radar backscatter measurement input (Multiple Solution Scheme), State of the art quality control procedures, Two-dimensional variational ambiguity removal.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://nwpsaf.org" rel="enclosure" title="NWP SAF Software" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Medium Resolution Sea Ice Drift - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Sea_Ice"/><category term="Ocean"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:NH-MR-SID</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:NH-MR-SID" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:NH-MR-SID" rel="alternate" title="Medium Resolution Sea Ice Drift - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Ocean and Sea Ice</name><email>osi-saf.manager@meteo.fr</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:26Z</updated><summary>Medium Resolution Sea Ice Drift product covers The Northern Hemisphere (NH) above 40 Deg. N. Ice motion vectors with a time span of approximately 24 hours are estimated by a maximum cross-correlation method (MCC) on pairs of satellite images. The ice drift product is based on swath data from the AVHRR instrument onboard the Metop-A satellite. VISible data are used to determine ice motion during summer (MJJA) and Thermal InfraRed data are used from September to April. Valid drift data are only available in cloud free areas, due to cloud opacity of VIS and TIR data.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>40 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>Unrestricted</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.osi-saf.org/" rel="enclosure" title="OSI SAF FTP service" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - MSG" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Land Surface Analysis</name><email>helpdesk.landsaf@ipma.pt</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:26Z</updated><summary>The Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation (faPAR, The Fraction of Absorbed Photosynthetically Active Radiation) is an indicator of the state and productivity of vegetation and has been recognized as a fundamental surface parameter for environmental studies by international organizations. This quantity represents the fraction of the solar energy which is absorbed by vegetation and therefore plays the role of a battery during the plant photosynthetic process.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -79.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 79.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/lsa_fAPAR.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://landsaf.meteo.pt" rel="enclosure" title="LSA SAF Archive and FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - In addition, it announces the introduction of new products and modifications to existing products.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - IASI GDS Level 1C - all spectral samples - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL1C-ALL</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL1C-ALL" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL1C-ALL" rel="alternate" title="IASI GDS Level 1C - all spectral samples - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:27Z</updated><summary>This product covers all spectral samples. The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally it is used for the determination of trace gases such as ozone, nitrous oxide, carbon dioxide and methane, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. The IASI L1c product contains infra-red radiance spectra at 0.5cm-1 resolution. The EUMETCast product has for each sounder pixel 8461 spectral samples covering the range between 645.0 cm-1 and 2760 cm-1.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/iasi.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=IASxxx1C" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/wcm/idc/idcplg?IdcService=GET_FILE&dDocName=ZIP_METOP_IASIL1C-ALL_SAMPLE_FILES&RevisionSelectionMethod=LatestReleased&Rendition=Web" rel="enclosure" title="Sample product file" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - In combination with AMSU-A information it can also be used to process precipitation rates and related cloud properties, as well as to detect sea ice and snow coverage.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/metopmhsl1.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MHSxxx1B" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/WMOInformationSystem/GTSRMDCN/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="GTS Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The product is PDU based, in NetCDF-4 GDSV2 format with internal compression. This IASI SST product is compliant with the specification from the Group for High Resolution Sea Surface Temperatures (GHRSST).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/image_mgrmap.gif" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>Unrestricted</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.osi-saf.org" rel="enclosure" title="OSI SAF Archive and FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Effective Snow Cover by VIS/IR Radiometry</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Atmospheric conditions"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Precipitation"/><category term="Observation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:OBS:SNOBS3</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:OBS:SNOBS3" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:OBS:SNOBS3" rel="alternate" title="Effective Snow Cover by VIS/IR Radiometry" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>SAF on Support to Operational Hydrology and Water Management</name><email>us_hsaf@meteoam.it</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:27Z</updated><summary>The combined effect, within a product resolution element, of fractional snow cover and other reflective contributors is used to estimate the fractional cover at resolution element level. The product may be processed in different ways and have different quality depending on the surface being flat, forested or mountainous. The algorithm is based on multi-channel analysis of AVHRR, the most important being those in short-wave, thus the product is generated in daylight. The deficit of brightness in respect of the maximum one is correlated to the lack of snow in the product resolution element. In the case of forests, the signal attenuation due to forest canopy obstruction is taken in to account by application of transmissivity map assembled in advance using MODIS and GlobCover land cover data. In order to search for cloud-free pixels, multi-temporal analysis is performed over all images available in 24 hours (in daylight).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-25 25</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>75 45</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/sn-obs-3.png" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://hsaf.meteoam.it/" rel="enclosure" title="SAF Archive & FTP" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Interim Geophysical Data Record - Jason-2</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Ocean"/><category term="Ocean_Surface_Wind"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:JASON:IGDR</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:JASON:IGDR" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:JASON:IGDR" rel="alternate" title="Interim Geophysical Data Record - Jason-2" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales</name><email>-</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:27Z</updated><summary>The Interim Geophysical Data Record (IGDR) is available to users within 2 days from instrument sensing. The main geophysical parameters in the IGDR product, derived from the Poseidon altimeter on-board the Jason2 satellite, are sea surface height, significant wave height and ocean surface wind speed. Additionally, all necessary magnitudes contributing to the estimation of the sea surface height are provided as well, such altimeter ranges, orbit data (altitude), water vapour correction, geophysical corrections and geophysical references. Finally, other important parameters, intended to help with the interpretation and use of the data for different applications, are provided as well, such as for example backscatter coefficients and a range of instrument and processing quality flags. Both 1Hz and 20Hz sampling data are included. The orbit used to compute sea surface height is estimated on ground from DORIS and Laser Ranging measurements. Each file contains data corresponding to a pole to pole pass. This product is mainly targeting operational oceanography applications.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-66.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>66.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/jason-2.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://www.aviso.oceanobs.com" rel="enclosure" title="AVISO" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.nsof.class.noaa.gov" rel="enclosure" title="NOAA_CLASS_Archive" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Operational Geophysical Data Record (netCDF) - SARAL</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Wave"/><category term="Ocean"/><category term="Ocean_Surface_Wind"/><category term="Sea_Surface_Height"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:SARAL:S-OGDR</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:SARAL:S-OGDR" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:SARAL:S-OGDR" rel="alternate" title="Operational Geophysical Data Record (netCDF) - SARAL" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>National Remote Sensing Centre Indian Space Research Organisation</name><email>feedback@nrsc.gov.in</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:29Z</updated><summary>The Operational Geophysical Data Record (OGDR) is a near real-time operational product delivered to users within 3 - 5 hours from instrument sensing. The main geophysical parameters in the OGDR product, derived from the AltiKa Ka-band altimeter on-board the SARAL satellite, are significant wave height and ocean surface wind speed. Additionally, all necessary magnitudes contributing to the estimation of the sea surface height are provided as well, such altimeter ranges, orbit data (altitude), water vapour correction, geophysical corrections and geophysical references. Finally, other important parameters, intended to help with the interpretation and use of the data for different applications, are provided as well, such as for example backscatter coefficients and a range of instrument and processing quality flags. Both 1Hz and 20Hz sampling data are included. This product is mainly targeting operational weather and ocean forecasting applications. This data set is generated by EUMETSAT.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.49 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.49 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=OGDRGDKA" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - SPOT - Africa" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>VITO</name><email>helpdeskticket@vgt.vito.be</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:28Z</updated><summary>The Vegetation Productivity Indicator (VPI) is used to assess the overall vegetation condition and is a categorical type of difference vegetation index, whereby the actual NDVI is referenced against the NDVI percentiles of the historical year.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-35.0 -26.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>38.0 60.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/ndvi.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Aqua - US West Coast" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration</name><email>paul.seymour@noaa.gov</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:29Z</updated><summary>Chlorophyll concentration provides an estimate of the live phytoplankton biomass in the surface layer. It is also referred to as the amount of the green pigment chlorophyll. Ocean Color is the water hue due to the presence of tiny plants containing the pigment chlorophyll, sediments, and coloured dissolved organic material. Chlorophyll is reported in values between .001 - 64.767 micrograms per liter. Products in GeoTIFF format are scaled to 1 to 100.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>28.0 -143.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>52.0 -111.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/West Coast.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://www.geonetcastamericas.noaa.gov/" rel="enclosure" title="GEONETCast Americas" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.nodc.noaa.gov/" rel="enclosure" title="Access the product" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Vegetation Index Compared with average [%] - Multimission - Southern Africa</title><category term="environment"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Vegetation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:NDVIDIFFAVGPN</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:NDVIDIFFAVGPN" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:NDVIDIFFAVGPN" rel="alternate" title="Vegetation Index Compared with average [%] - Multimission - Southern Africa" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>Botswana Department of Meteorological Services</name><email>imkusane@gmail.com</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:28Z</updated><summary>An AMESD / SADC-THEMA product. vegetation index anomaly as a percentage deviation from the average. For cloudy and partially cloudy scenes, the cloud-top pressure replaces the nearest pressure level. Geographical coverage, spatial resolution and temporal frequencies of the GOME-2 Ozone Profile Product are determined by the instrument. This product is not archived. For an archived version, please refer to the Offline Ozone Profile.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/o3m_nop.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://o3msaf.fmi.fi" rel="enclosure" title="O3M_SAF_Archive_and_FTP" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Much of this information cannot be generated fast enough for use in early NWP model runs due to the delay in obtaining MODIS and AVHRR data (typically 1-4 hrs). To improve the timeliness of the wind data, direct broadcast (DB) sites provide real-time access to water vapour winds (wvap) bufr files from MODIS data, as well as IR cloud-drift winds (cdft) bufr files from both MODIS and AVHRR data.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/modis_winds.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Atmospheric Temperature Water Vapour and Surface Skin Temperature Error Estimate - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Temperature"/><category term="Humidity"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2TWT_ERR</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2TWT_ERR" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASIL2TWT_ERR" rel="alternate" title="Atmospheric Temperature Water Vapour and Surface Skin Temperature Error Estimate - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:29Z</updated><summary>The main objective of the Infrared Atmospheric Sounding Interferometer (IASI) is to provide high resolution atmospheric emission spectra to derive temperature and humidity profiles with high spectral and vertical resolution and accuracy. Additionally it is used for the determination of trace gases, as well as land and sea surface temperature, emissivity and cloud properties. The atmospheric Temperature and Water Vapour error (TWT_ERR) contains the full retrieval error estimate (error covariance matrix) for the atmospheric temperature and humidity profiles retrieved with the optimal estimation method (OEM). The products are provided at the single IASI footprint resolution (which is about 12 km with a spatial sampling of about 25 km at Nadir). This product is available via the Data Centre as the IASI Combined Sounding Products: EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:IASSND02.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=IASSND02" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - HRI Level 1.5 Image Data - MFG - Indian Ocean</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><category term="GEONETCast"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Ocean"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:HRI-IODC</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:HRI-IODC" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MFG:HRI-IODC" rel="alternate" title="HRI Level 1.5 Image Data - MFG - Indian Ocean" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:29Z</updated><summary>Image data in the form of high rate transmissions in 3 spectral channels available at 30-minute intervals with coverage over the Indian Ocean. Level 1.5 images are pre-processed in such a way that all image pixels are remapped on to a reference image corresponding to an image taken by the MTP satellite located at its nominal position over the equator and with a nominal attitude, i.e. with the satellite spin axis parallel to the spin axis of the earth. In addition, all image lines are aligned and the coordinates of image pixels of the different radiometer channels are adjusted so that they correspond to information from the same point on the earth's surface.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-81.0 -24.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>81.0 138.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/METEOSAT7-IODC.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTP15" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#meteosatdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Meteosat Direct Dissemination Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The Microwave Surface and Precipitation Products System (MSPPS) project is dedicated to the retrieval of near-real-time operational surface and precipitation products using antenna temperatures from the AMSU-A and AMSU-B/MHS instruments on board of NOAA's KLMNN series and the EUMETSAT Polar System's (EPS) Metop series of polar-orbiting satellites.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.geonetcastamericas.noaa.gov/" rel="enclosure" title="GEONETCast-Americas" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The underlying concept of the algorithm takes advantage of the fact that SEVIRI channel IR3.9 is very sensitive to hot spots which are caused by fires. The algorithm distinguishes between potential fire and active fire. Applications and Users: Fire detection and monitoring.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>33.0 -45.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/img_jpg_mprod_fir_portugal_med.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MSGFIRG" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The MFG low resolution 80 x 80 segment matrix (with 32 x 32 pixel segments) is used and vectors are derived by tracking the motion of clouds only; height assignment is based on IR EBBT. Before 2 December 2002 the ELW product derived vectors from all three MFG channels. A typical ELW product contains about 2000 IR vectors.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -8.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 122.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/meteosatelw.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MTPLRWI" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/WMOInformationSystem/GTSRMDCN/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="GTS Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Registration" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - DMSP" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>Climate SAF</name><email>contact.cmsaf@dwd.de</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:12Z</updated><summary>Following a neural network approach after Krasnopolsky et al. (1995), the wind speed is estimated using a fully connected 3-layer feed forward neural network. Two different data sets serve as input for the training data set, one derived from radiosonde profiles and radiative transfer simulations and a second one from collocated SSM/I and buoy observations. This approach ensures the representativeness of the input and output data of the neural network. This is a Thematic Climate Data Record (TCDR).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-80 -180</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>80 180</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/example_image_SWS_20000131.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://wui.cmsaf.eu" rel="enclosure" title="CM SAF Web User Interface" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=CLMSWS" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - An AMESD / SADC-THEMA product.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-35.0 -11.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>6.0 40.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Normalised Difference Vegetation Index Decadal - MSG - 0 degree</title><category term="environment"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Vegetation"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:NDVD</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:NDVD" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:NDVD" rel="alternate" title="Normalised Difference Vegetation Index Decadal - MSG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:13Z</updated><summary>The decadal Normalised Difference Vegetation Index product is derived from the daily NDVI products. The NDVD is an aggregated product based on the daily NDVI products using the following aggregation periods: Aggregated NDVD product covering Days 1 to 10 of each month, Days 11 to 20 of each month and covering Day 21 to the last day of each month. The NDVD product estimates the land surface characteristics derived from satellite data. It is widely used to characterise the density and vigour of the given vegetation cover as well as to identify vegetation stress and drought. Applications and Users: Land surface applications. Used Input Data: Reflectances from the SEVIRI Level 1.5 image data for the VIS0.6 \ufffd\ufffdm and the VIS0.8 \ufffd\ufffdm channels.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -65.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MSGNDVD" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW -
