During the daytime, a near-infrared algorithm is applied over clear land areas of the globe and above clouds over both land and ocean. Over clear ocean areas, watervapor estimates are provided over the extended glint area. An infrared algorithm for deriving atmospheric profiles is also applied both day and night for Level 2. The solar retrieval algorithm relies on observations of water-vapor attenuation of reflected solar radiation in the near-infrared MODIS channels so that the product is produced only over areas where there is a reflective surface in the near IR.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>25.0 -60.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 45.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/Water_Vapor_Near_Infrared_thn.png" rel="icon" title=""/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Ground based mesurements of current cumulate Rainfall compared with the Long Term Average, Maximum and Minimum values for assessment and detection of possible anomalies (mm). The product is calculated as follows: (Current cumulate Rainfall \ufffd\ufffd LTAvg cumulate Rainfall); (Current cumulate Rainfall \ufffd\ufffd LTMax cumulate Rainfall), (Current cumulate Rainfall \ufffd\ufffd LTMin cumulate Rainfall).</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-35.0 -11.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>6.0 41</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - MODIS - Aqua/Terra - Central America" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>NASA SERVIR</name><email>info@nasa.gov</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:11Z</updated><summary>The Daily Fire Image is a product used to monitor the location and extent of fires and their potential impact in the region. The images are based on MODIS data taken from on board the Terra and Aqua satellites. The data are processed within the SERVIR Fire Rapid Response System into fire products within 3-4 hours after acquisition. Three products are made from both Aqua and Terra at 250, 500 and 1000 meter spatial resolutions.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>13.1 -93.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>19.0 -87.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/SERVIR_FIRE.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.geonetcastamericas.noaa.gov/" rel="enclosure" title="GEONETCast Americas" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - It is based on EUMETCast, the EUMETSAT Satellite broadcasting system, which allows distribution of M\ufffd\ufffdt\ufffd\ufffdo-France products over Europe and Africa. See Categorisation/Online Resources for the list of products being distributed.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-45 -30</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>60 102</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/Home/Main/DataAccess/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSet-up/index.htm?l=en" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - Real Evapotranspiration - NOAA - South America</title><category term="biota"/><category term="Land"/><category term="Vegetation"/><category term="Humidity"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:ETR</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:ETR" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:NOAA:ETR" rel="alternate" title="Real Evapotranspiration - NOAA - South America" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EC Copernicus Global Land Service, operated by INTA</name><email>Poricchio@cnia.inta.gov.ar</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:11Z</updated><summary>The ETR images show the amount of water, in mm/day, which is effectively evaporated from the ground surface and transpirated by the vegetation coverage. ETR values for each image pixel are calculated weekly from the best daily Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) and surface temperature (Ts) images, as ETR = (-88.34 + 1.77 * Ts + 286.4 * NDVI) / 30. Can be used free-of-charge, but may not be (re-)sold. Please acknowledge INTA in publications.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-41.1 -66.1</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>-27.3 -54.8</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/mapa.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - A-DCS AHRPT - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ADCS-AHRPT</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ADCS-AHRPT" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ADCS-AHRPT" rel="alternate" title="A-DCS AHRPT - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:11Z</updated><summary>The AHRPT Direct Broadcast service provides local user stations with real-time transmission of data, limited to the instantaneous sub-satellite observation. Data received through Direct Readout can be processed further using the local processing software is available under licence from the NWP-SAF (AAPP and RTTOVS). The Argos Advanced Data Collection System (A-DCS) is a data collection relay system. The primary objective is the collection and dissemination of data for the scientific community, through measurement of temperature, pressure, humidity, sea levels and location. The data are then transmitted to the user community through the Argos network. Flying the Argos system aboard polar-orbiting satellites provides worldwide coverage. Additionally, incorporating the A-DCS instrument on a moving satellite allows for locating an in-situ platform using Doppler shift calculations. This positioning capability permits applications such as monitoring drifting ocean buoys and studying wildlife migration paths.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#metopdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Metop Direct Readout Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - HIRS AHRPT - Metop</title><category term="climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere"/><category term="Level_1_Data"/><category term="Atmosphere"/><id>urn:uuid:EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:HIRSAHRPT</id><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/soapServices/CSWStartup?service=CSW&version=2.0.2&request=GetRecordById&outputSchema=http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi&Id=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:HIRSAHRPT" rel="via" type="application/xml"/><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/discovery/Start/DirectSearch/DetailResult.do?f(r0)=EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:HIRSAHRPT" rel="alternate" title="HIRS AHRPT - Metop" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>EUMETSAT</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:14Z</updated><summary>The AHRPT Direct Broadcast service provides local user stations with real-time transmission of data, limited to the instantaneous sub-satellite observation. Data received through Direct Readout can be processed further using the local processing software is available under licence from the NWP-SAF (AAPP and RTTOVS). The High Resolution Infrared Sounder (HIRS) operates at 20 channels (19 channels in the infrared and one in the visible). Its main purpose is to provide input for the vertical temperature and humidity profile retrievals. In addition, the HIRS pixel resolution serves as the standard grid resolution for all ATOVS level 2 products.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-90.0 -180.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>90.0 180.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/DirectDissemination/index.html#metopdirect" rel="enclosure" title="Metop Direct Readout Information" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - The winds are derived for all three spectral channels (VIS in half resolution) as for the ELW Product. However, the CMW product only includes the best wind for each segment determined from the QI value. There are other limitations, specified in the dissemination limit table. A typical product will contain up to 750 winds per channel. The product is distributed for the synoptic hours of 00, 06, 12 and 18 UTC in SATOB code. VIS/IR images from GEO are used. The product may be processed in different ways and have different quality depending on the surface being flat, forested or mountainous. The algorithm is based on thresholding of several channels of SEVIRI, the most important being those in short-wave, thus the product is generated in daylight. In order to search for cloud-free pixels, multi-temporal analysis is performed over all images available in 24 hours (in daylight)</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>25.0 25.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>75.0 45.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/sn-obs-1.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/Registration" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Registration" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/><link href="http://hsaf.meteoam.it/" rel="enclosure" title="SAF Archive & FTP" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - FengYun 2E" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>China Meteorological Administration</name><email>zhangjs@cma.gov.cn</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:13Z</updated><summary>Atmopsheric motion vectors (AMVs) are a valuable observation type for providing dynamical information for forecast models. They are produced by tracking clouds or gradients in water vapour through successive satellite images. AMVs have been assimilated in forecast models since the 1980s. Traditionally they are generated using imagery from geostationary satellites, which monitor a constant region of the Earth. AMVs are produced at several centres including EUMETSAT in Europe, NESDIS in the USA, JMA in Japan, CMA in China and IMD in India.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-50.0 55.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>50.0 155.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/ProductIntro_AMV_map1.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><link href="http://2011.cma.gov.cn/en/" rel="enclosure" title="CMACast" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - MSG - 0 degree" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites</name><email>ops@eumetsat.int</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:13Z</updated><summary>The active fire monitoring product is a fire detection product indicating the presence of fire within a pixel. The underlying concept of the algorithm takes advantage of the fact that SEVIRI channel IR3.9 is very sensitive to hot spots which are caused by fires. The algorithm distinguishes between potential fire and active fire. Applications and Users: Fire detection and monitoring. This product is available in CAP (Common Alert Protocol) format. The CAP formatted product is only disseminated when a fire/potential fire is detected in any given repeat cycle.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-65.0 -65.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>65.0 65.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/fir.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>-</rights><rights>geossDataCore</rights><rights>geossNoMonetaryCharge</rights><rights>geossuserRegistration</rights><rights>geossAttribution</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/protected/dataCentre.faces?acronym=MSGFIRC" rel="enclosure" title="Order this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETSATDataCentre/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Data Centre Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - SPOT - South America" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>VITO</name><email>helpdeskticket@vgt.vito.be</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:14Z</updated><summary>A ratio of the intensity of light reflected off the Earth's surface in the visible and near-infrared spectral wavelengths, which quantifies the photosynthetic capacity of the vegetation in a given pixel of land surface. The maximum value for each pixel of a composite period is used as the value for that pixel. Since cloud and other atmospheric perturbations reduce NDVI values, these are eliminated from the final composite product. Access to VEGETATION data is free of charge for all users in Africa and South/Central America and EUMETSAT Member State NMS.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-56.0 -93.0</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>25.0 -33.0</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><rights>-</rights><link href="http://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt" rel="enclosure" title="Subscribe to this product" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="EUMETCast Information" type="text/html"/><link href="http://www.eumetsat.int/website/home/Data/DataDelivery/EUMETCast/ReceptionStationSetup/index.html" rel="enclosure" title="Reception Station Set-up" type="text/html"/></entry><entry xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"><title>NEW - SAC-C - South America" type=""/><generator uri="http://navigator.eumatsat.int" version="2.1">terraCatalog</generator><author><name>Comisi\ufffd\ufffdn Nacional de Actividades Espaciales </name><email>storrusio@conae.gov.ar</email></author><updated>2015-03-13T07:16:16Z</updated><summary>The SAC-C MMRS is a product created by the integration of bands 4, 3 and 2 in RGB. Every day, the product is processed from the raw data in the 6 degrees South Latitude to 56 degrees South Latitude region. There are six sections; 1 through 6.. They refer to the individual strips that make up an entire image. Raw Images from MMRS have the following characteristics: Spectral Resolution: 5 bands, (#1: 480 - 500 nm,  #2: 540 - 560 nm, #3: 630 - 690 nm, #4: 795 - 835 nm, #5 1550 - 1700 nm); Spatial Resolution: 175 m; Radiometric Resolution: 8 bit; Swath: 360 km.</summary><georss:where xmlns:georss="http://www.georss.org/georss"><gml:Envelope srsName="urn:x-ogc:def:crs:EPSG:6.7:4326" xmlns:gml="http://www.opengis.net/gml"><gml:lowerCorner>-56.16 -89.11</gml:lowerCorner><gml:upperCorner>-6.47 -39.44</gml:upperCorner></gml:Envelope></georss:where><link href="http://navigator.eumetsat.int:80/smartEditor/preview/MMRS.jpg" rel="icon" title="" type="image/jpeg"/><rights>Interested users may access the images made available free of cost through the internet. SAC-C images shall be only used for non-commercial purposes.
